sentences.en: A broad valley opened up leading to a high, flat plateau of cultivated land.
sentences.cn: 一条宽阔的山谷展现在眼前，通往一处平整的开垦地高原。

sentences.en: As the river drops from the plateau, it forms great waterfalls.
sentences.cn: 河水从高原上下落时, 形成了巨大的瀑布.

sentences.en: I think the economy is stuck on a kind of plateau of slow growth.
sentences.cn: 我认为经济将停留在缓慢发展的阶段。

sentences.en: Inflation rates have reached a plateau.
Soon we reached a plateau at an elevation of about ninety feet.
sentences.cn: 我们很快就抵达一片高度约九十英尺的高原.

sentences.en: The athletic footwear market has not yet plat-eaued.
sentences.cn: 运动鞋市场还未达到饱和。

sentences.en: The explorers struck out for the plateau at dawn.
sentences.cn: 勘探人员天一亮就精神抖擞地向高原进发.

sentences.en: The Qinghai - Tibet Plateau is the world's highest plateau, averaging over 4000 metres above sea level and covering an area of 200,000 square kilometres.
sentences.cn: 中国的 青藏 高原是世界最高的高原.平均高度在海拔4000米以上,面积达20万平方公里.

sentences.en: The Qinghai - Xizang Plateau has long been known as the roof of the world.
sentences.cn: 青藏 高原素有世界屋脊之称.

sentences.en: The response reaches a plateau when large meals are taken.
sentences.cn: 当摄入的饭食量很大时,这种效应会达到高峰.

sentences.en: The road straightened and we were on a plateau.
sentences.cn: 路变直了，我们驶上了高原。

sentences.en: Thence, bending to our left, we began to ascend the slope towards the plateau.
sentences.cn: 我们从那里向左拐, 开始攀登通向台地的斜坡.

sentences.en: They have been herding cattle on the plateau for generations.
sentences.cn: 他们世世代代在这高原上放牧.

sentences.en: This region of slow percentage increase is called the plateau.
sentences.cn: 这个增长百分率缓慢的区域称为坪.

sentences.en: This region percentage slow increase is called the plateau.
sentences.cn: 计数率缓慢增加的区域称为坪.

sentences.en: We took a plane south-west across the Anatolian plateau to Cappadocia.
sentences.cn: 我们乘飞机向着西南方向越过安纳托利亚高原，前往卡帕多西亚。

words.tran_cn: [地理]高原；稳定水平；托盘；平顶女帽
达到平衡；达到稳定时期

phrases.tran_cn: 职业高原；职业生涯高原
科罗拉多高原（美国西南部高原）

trans.tran_cn: 高原，平稳时期，稳定水平，停滞期
trans.tran_en: a large area of flat land that is higher than the land around it

trans.tran_cn: 进入停滞期，达到平稳状态
trans.tran_en: if something plateaus, it reaches and then stays at a particular level
if something plateaus, it reaches and then stays at a particular level
